Package game

Class GameParser

java.lang.Object
game.GameParser
abstract class GameParser extends Object
Utility class used to parse the input file into a game

  • Method Details

    • validateData

      private static void validateData(TreasureMap treasureMap, List<Adventurer> adventurers) throws InvalidDataException
      Checks that nothing is out of the map's bounds, if there is throws an exception
      Parameters:
      treasureMap - Parsed map
      adventurers - Parsed adventurers
      Throws:
      InvalidDataException - if either the adventurers or the tiles are out of bounds

    • parseTreasure

      private static Treasure parseTreasure(String[] parameters) throws InvalidDataException
      Parameters:
      parameters - Array of string expected to hold all the information defining a Treasure
      Returns:
      The parsed treasure
      Throws:
      InvalidDataException - if the parameters could not be used to parse a treasure

    • parseMountain

      private static Mountain parseMountain(String[] parameters) throws InvalidDataException
      Parameters:
      parameters - Array of string expected to hold all the information defining a Mountain
      Returns:
      The parsed mountain
      Throws:
      InvalidDataException - if the parameters could not be used to parse a mountain

    • parseTreasureMap

      private static void parseTreasureMap(TreasureMapBuilder treasureMapBuilder, String[] parameters) throws InvalidDataException
      Parameters:
      treasureMapBuilder - Using a builder in order to add tiles later
      parameters - Array of string expected to hold the width and height of the map
      Throws:
      InvalidDataException - if the parameters could not be used to parse a map

    • parseAdventurer

      private static Adventurer parseAdventurer(String[] parameters) throws InvalidDataException
      Parameters:
      parameters - Array of string expected to hold all the information defining an Adventurer
      Returns:
      The parsed adventurer
      Throws:
      InvalidDataException - if the parameters could not be used to parse an adventurer

    • parseActions

      private static List<Action> parseActions(String tokens) throws InvalidDataException
      Parameters:
      tokens - A sequence of letters to be split and then parsed into several actions
      Returns:
      A list of the parsed actions
      Throws:
      InvalidDataException - If any token could not be parsed into an action

    • load

      public static Game load(String inputFilePath) throws IOException, InvalidDataException
      Parameters:
      inputFilePath - Input file used to parse the game
      Returns:
      The parsed Game
      Throws:
      InvalidDataException - When even one line could not be successfully parsed, except comments
      IOException

    • save

      private static void save(Game game, PrintStream printStream)
      Saves the game into a file, its format is almost exactly identical to the output file, although it cannot directly be used as an input file
      Parameters:
      game - Game to save
      printStream - PrintStream used to write into the selected file

    • save

      public static void save(Game game, String outputFilePath) throws IOException
      Save the game using a preferred output file
      Parameters:
      game - Game to save
      outputFilePath - Preferred file to save in
      Throws:
      IOException

      Prints the game's state on the standard output
      Parameters:
